steps.title: Multiply
steps.content: Multiply the cost of an item or service by the sales tax in order to find out the total cost . The equation looks like this: Item or service cost x sales tax (in decimal form) = total sales tax . Add the total sales tax to the Item or service cost to get your total cost. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Once you've calculated sales tax, make sure to add it to the original cost to get the total cost.
steps.content: Once you've calculated sales tax, make sure to add it to the original cost to get the total cost. If the total sales tax is $5 and your original item cost was $100, your total cost will be $105. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Try this example.
steps.content: Try this example. You're buying a basketball in the state of Colorado, where sales tax is 2.9%. [3] X Research source The basketball costs $25. How much is the total cost of the basketball, including sales tax?

steps.title: Try another example.
steps.content: Try another example. You're buying groceries in the state of Mississippi, where the sales tax is 7%. [4] X Research source The grocery bill costs $300. How much is the total cost of the grocery bill, including sales tax?

steps.title: Try a third example.
steps.content: Try a third example. You're buying a car in the state of Massachusetts, where sales tax is 6.25%. [5] X Trustworthy Source State of Massachusetts Official website for the State of Massachusetts Go to source The car costs $15,000. How much is the total cost of the car, including sales tax?

steps.title: "De-calculate" by working backward if you know the original cost of the item.
steps.content: "De-calculate" by working backward if you know the original cost of the item. [6] X Research source You can work backwards to figure out the sales tax rate as long as you know how much the item initially cost.

steps.title: Know that some American states do not have sales tax.
steps.content: Know that some American states do not have sales tax. These states currently include: [7] X Research source Delaware New Hampshire Montana Oregon Alaska

steps.title: Know that states levy different taxes for different goods.
steps.content: Know that states levy different taxes for different goods. A state or district, such as District of Columbia, may have a general sales tax of 6%, but set the tax rate on liquor and prepared food at 10%. [8] X Research source New Hampshire, for example, has no general sales tax but still taxes restaurants, food services, hotels, room rentals, and motor vehicle rentals at 9%. [9] X Research source Massachusetts, for example, only starts counting sales tax associated with clothing when the bill exceeds $175. So if you buy under $175 worth of clothing in Massachusetts, the state government won't tax it. [10] X Trustworthy Source State of Massachusetts Official website for the State of Massachusetts Go to source

steps.title: Be sure to check with your local state and city when calculating sales tax.
steps.content: Be sure to check with your local state and city when calculating sales tax. We don't often talk of "city sales tax," but it's there. [11] X Research source Most people, however, just lump it in with state sales tax. If you want to know exactly how much money you'll pay in taxes for a certain item, check your local state and city tax laws for more information Each city has its own tax, and it depends on where it's shipping to and where it's shipping from.
